results.title: Nostromo. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Pixit, BBC, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola, WGBH (Boston), Fernando Ghia and Alastair Reid
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Joseph Conrad, set in South America in the late 1880’s. An Englishman, Charles Gould, and his wife Emilia return to his childhood home to reopen his silver mine. Determined to make the mine succeed, he becomes involved in corruption, conspiracy and revolution. Gould becomes obsessed with saving the silver mine but there is only one man he can trust - Nostromo. Starring Colin Firth, Claudio Amendola, Lothaire Bluteau, Albert Finney, Claudia Cardinale and Brian Dennehy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pixit, BBC, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola, WGBH (Boston), Fernando Ghia and Alastair Reid

results.title: Nostalgia greats
results.brief_description: Due to the unique material contained herein, fluctuations may occur in picture and sound quality during the program. Take a trip down memory lane with this compilation of excerpts from some of Hollywood’s classic musicals and live performances featuring many of Hollywood’s famous stars and entertainers. It includes musical numbers from “Till the Clouds Roll By” (1947), a biopic of Jerome Kern, and includes the “Showboat”, “Sally”, “Jumbo” and finale sequences featuring Kathryn Grayson, Virginia O’Brien, Lena Horne, Tony Martin and Frank Sinatra. Also features archival footage from the US wartime “Command Performance” with Judy Garland singing “Over the rainbow”, and performances by Betty Hutton, and the Andrew Sisters. Other highlights include Maurice Chevalier singing “Louise” and Al Jolson singing “Mammie”.

results.title: Nosferatu. Vampyr
results.brief_description: Dreyer’s ‘Vampyr’ (dir. Carl Theodor Dreyer, prods. Carl Theodor Dreyer, Nicolas de Gunsburg) redefined the Vampire by casting an eerie woman as the vampire and shooting the entire film with black gauge on the lens to create a haunting, misty mis-en-scene that lingers with each viewing. Cast includes Julian West, Maurice Schutz and Sybille Schmitz. ‘Nosferatu’ (dir. F. W. Murnau, prods. Albin Grau, Enrico Dieckmann) is the original Dracula movie, complete with misty woods, wolves, phantom ships, mutes, coaches and grotesque figures, tropes that are considered standard today in the genre. Cast includes Max Schreck, Alexander Granach and Gustav von Wangenheim. Also included on the tape a rehearsals from varying productions of Dracula.

results.title: Nosferatu - phantom of the night = Nosferatu - phantom der nacht
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Werner Herzog
results.brief_description: An assault on the senses and the emotions, this film is at once bold and subtle, comic and confounding, disturbing and ultimately deeply moving. A film whose triumph is its originality and uniqueness in dealing with classical material that has seen hundreds of permutations since Bram Stoker first published his novel “Dracula” nearly a century ago. Each delicious shudder takes the viewer deeper into the gorgeously sombre nightmare world that director Herzog has painted in delicate and fragile tones, deriving much from the original F.W. Murnau “Nosferatu” silent classic. Stars Klaus Kinski and Isabelle Adjani. English version (dubbed).

results.title: Nose and Tina
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig and Norma Bailey
results.brief_description: Nose and Tina are two people in love. He works as a brakeman, she as a hooker. This documentary film captures the domestic details of their life together, and their problems with the law, work and money. Theirs is an unusual love story.

results.title: Norwich: a cathedral city
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films, EFVA and Nigel Rea
results.brief_description: The film shows the development of Norwich as a nodal point for the whole of Norfolk. The modern city is shown to have a variety of industries, including the manufacture of footwear and food products, together with engineering and printing.

results.title: Norwegian fisheries
results.brief_description: Traces the development and organisation of the Norwegian fishing industry. Shows the variety of fishing methods, the handling and processing of the catch. A fisherman and his wife discuss life in the coastal village and the outlook for the future.
results.description: Traces the development and organisation of the Norwegian fishing industry. Shows the variety of fishing methods, the handling and processing of the catch. A fisherman and his wife discuss life in the coastal village and the outlook for the future.

results.title: Norwegian contrasts
results.brief_description: Tourists come to admire the physical and cultural beauties of Norway, but there is more to the country than that…there has always been the sea. Norwegian fishermen are responsible for 5 percent of the global catch. The film goes on to cover the problems associated with agriculture, the drift to the cities, industrialisation and pollution.

results.title: Norwegian children: farming on a fiord
results.brief_description: A farm family on a fiord in Western Norway. Shows activities of children and mother tending livestock on the mountains during summer; dairying activities such as milking, cheese making and transporting milk to the dairy in the valley. Concludes with a neighbourhood festival to celebrate the homecoming of the women and the children.

results.title: Norwegian architecture and applied arts
results.creator_credit: Informasjonsfilm and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Examines the origins of modern Norwegian architecture in the home crafts of rural Norway. Scenes depict craftsmen at work wood carving, glass blowing, pottery making, weaving and making jewellery and enamel ware.
